meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a snib.
meanings.sent1: She snibbed the gate to keep the dog in the yard.
meanings.sent2: He always snibbed the window before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel snibbed the bird feeder shut, leaving the birds puzzled.
meanings.sent4: His determination snibbed his focus on the goal, ignoring all distractions.
meanings.sent5: The old lock snibbed shut with a satisfying click.

meanings.definition: To close or lock with a snib.
meanings.sent1: After checking the windows, she snibbed the front door securely.
meanings.sent2: He snibbed the suitcase before boarding the train.
meanings.sent3: The magician snibbed the box, making it disappear in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: The secret compartment snibbed closed, hiding the treasure within.
meanings.sent5: The gate snibbed shut, leaving the garden safe and peaceful.

meanings.definition: A latch or bolt used to fasten a door or gate.
meanings.sent1: The rusty snibbed on the barn door needed oiling.
meanings.sent2: She lifted the snibbed to open the garden gate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child played with the snibbed, pretending it was a tiny sword.
meanings.sent4: The golden snibbed gleamed in the sunlight, adding charm to the old gate.
meanings.sent5: The heavy snibbed clicked into place, securing the entrance.
